meanings.sent1: The cake was alright, not too sweet but just right.
meanings.sent2: She thought the movie was alright, nothing extraordinary but enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: His singing was alright, not bad for a beginner.
meanings.sent4: The weather was alright, neither too hot nor too cold.
meanings.sent5: The painting was alright, with decent colors and composition.

meanings.definition: In a satisfactory or acceptable manner.
meanings.sent1: She danced alright at the party, not too gracefully but with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: He played the guitar alright during the performance, keeping up with the rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed alright, demanding attention from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The car ran alright, smoothly cruising down the highway.
meanings.sent5: The student answered the question alright, showing understanding of the topic.

meanings.sent1: She will arrive alright at the airport, her flight is on time.
meanings.sent2: He will finish the project alright by the deadline, he is very efficient.
meanings.sent3: The sun will rise alright tomorrow, as it always does.
meanings.sent4: The train will depart alright at 9 AM, so be there on time.
meanings.sent5: The flowers will bloom alright in spring, nature's cycle continues.
